p: Sweet basil ( Ocimum basilicum L.) is an annual herbaceous plant in the Lamiaceae family, native to Asia, Africa, America, and the subtropics (Roman, 2012; Borloveanu, 2014). Many aromatic plants including basil are rich in secondary metabolites (Srivastava et al., 2014; Li et al., 2017). Having high commercial values, these secondary metabolites are exploited largely as flavors, fragrances and pharmaceuticals (Al-Maskri et al., 2011).
